text.0: The internet has made easy to fact-check claims and news information on the go but how do we fact-check in the absence of the internet? Read here: https://t.co/um5oPPZygl #DubawaChecks #FactChecks
text.1: A viral WhatsApp claim that the Federal Government is giving out a 3 million grant to Nigerians is false. Read the fact-check here: https://t.co/joIjKkh9uE #DubawaChecks #FactCheck
text.2: A claim that 63% of Nigerians under 30 are jobless or underemployed is mostly true. Data from NBS shows that 63.1% of Nigerians aged 15 to 34 are either jobless or underemployed. However, not all of them are under 30.  Read the facts here: https://t.co/YXzvxMw2nt #DubawaChecks
text.3: Fake News in Nigeria: How does it spread? Why does it spread? What impact does it have on our democracy? What efforts can be taken to fight it? This research offers a detailed explanation. Read here: https://t.co/rYqw3LaUC8 #DubawaChecks
